iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Seed Potato Development Project. The Seed Potato Project focuses on improving the seed and food potato production_ both in quality and quantity as well as in terms of improved skills_ at cooperative farms in Jonju County and partly in the whole Province. Fida partners with three large cooperative farms_ which have 500â1000 ha of farming land and 2000â3000 inhabitants each. The project started as cooperation with PMU Interlife in 2001. The aim of these cooperatives is to produce pure seed potato for those cooperative farms in the Province_ which grow food potato. The government of North Korea promotes potato production as a major element in enhancing food security in the country. The project provides the cooperatives with hands-on training in potato production through experimental potato farming. A great deal of attention is also paid to ensuring existence of sufficient storage facilities and effective distribution systems. Through the project the cooperatives will improve their capacities in seed and food potato farming. As the potato farming at the cooperatives improves_ the nutritional base that currently relies much on rice alone will become more varied. This_ in turn_ will improve the quality of life at the project farms

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Developing Potonggang and Jongju District Hospitals. The project seeks to improve the quality of health services at Potonggang and Jongju District Hospitals. The health care system in North Korea suffers from extensive lack of resources and well-trained staff. District level hospitals are unable to provide even basic health care for the residents. Fida cooperates with two district hospitals_ one in the capital city of Pyongyang and the other in North Pyongan Province. The project provides training for medical staff in various aspects of modern medicine. The two hospitals are given support in improving basic health care services_ and they also receive equipment and other supplies through the project. Through training_ the hospital staffâs professional knowledge and understanding of modern medicine will increase. Material assistance_ in turn_ helps the hospitals to provide much-needed health services to the residents. As a result_ the overall quality of district-level health services will improve.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Primary Dental Care Support Programme. The cooperation seeks to promote dental health among young generations in Pyongyang area by increasing the awareness of the causes to dental diseases and their preventive acts_ supporting the daily home care possibilities among the target population and by providing the cooperation hospitals with some material aid. Fidaâs partner is The Korea Education Fund (KEF)_ a non-governmental organization to support education approved by the government of the DPRK. The initiation to the work came from the local authorities and it was launched autumn 2007 in Pyongyangâs two districts. Because the work was expanding successfully_ the Primary Dental Care Support Programme was established in the beginning of 2009. The awareness of the programme has spread also to the other districts leading to several enquiries to the partner how to get along. The preventive work is based on the World Health Organizationâs (WHO) Oral Health Promotion Programme where the education comes close to the target population when given by community trainers while the professionals serve as mentors and supervisors. Tooth brushes_ pastes and educational material are distributed to the target group children in order to strengthen the education. The cooperation hospitals are provided with the mostly required equipment needed to treatment procedures. The project goal is to strengthen the basic knowledge of dental diseases and their prevention among the whole DPRK population. After the initiative phase_ the work is going to be shifted to the locals. Fidaâs representatives had a privilege to participate in a presentation seminar arranged by the partner in October 2008.

iati-activity.title: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finnish Red Cross)
iati-activity.description: Health Programme. To improve the lives and the general health and sanitation conditions of vulnerable communities through the promotion of the community based health care and water and sanitation activities.

iati-activity.title: Rehabilitation of health care services for people of DPRK
iati-activity.description: Aim of the project is to improve availability and quality of health services in North Korea by improving knowledge of family doctors and to facilities and quality of nursing in district hospitals.
iati-activity.participating-org: Finnish NGO, Suomen Punainen Risti, Helsingin ja Uude
